channel.title: Firefox to Internet explore
channel.description:
I develop my website with firefox. On school we only use Internet explore. I found out the files didn't work as it does on firefox. So Internet explore does not read the same codes.
Any idea? :(
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">

item.title: Firefox to Internet explore
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“goldstylez, post:5, topic:548897”][quote author=goldstylez link=topic=667805.msg4466079#msg4466079 date=1420223426]
I develop my website with firefox.
On school we only use Internet explore.
I found out the files didn’t work as it does on firefox.
So Internet explore does not read the same codes.

Any idea?

EDIT:
It’s a free website template from freewebsitetemplates.com
I guess all those templates has this problem?

IE does not read the JScript files for diashow. icons, and nav does show up.

I think there must be a simple solution because i never saw a website not working on IE

[/quote][/quote]

We need the template and/or access to your website with the template otherwise we can’t do anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox to Internet explore
item.dc:creator: @goldstylez goldstylez
item.description:
@goldstylez wrote:

[quote=“goldstylez, post:1, topic:548897”]I develop my website with firefox.
On school we only use Internet explore.
I found out the files didn’t work as it does on firefox.
So Internet explore does not read the same codes.

Any idea?

EDIT:
It’s a free website template from freewebsitetemplates.com
I guess all those templates has this problem?

IE does not read the JScript files for diashow. icons, and nav does show up.

I think there must be a simple solution because i never saw a website not working on IE :([/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox to Internet explore
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

sk8rdude461:

It helps to constantly check your website on multiple browsers while developing…

The Firefox developer edition browser has a great built-in tool for this.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox to Internet explore
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

IE is a pile of shit, but it actually has a lot of HTML5 functions in it (I think the latest version even has some functions that chrome doesn’t…).

That being said, developing for all browsers is a pain in the ass, and it’s only getting harder (with the more variants of screens showing up).
I haven’t used this, I literally just googled it, but you could try something like Normalize to reset your style sheets, and hopefully that will make everything the same on all browsers (or like the same, disregarding size issues), then you can develop your site from there to make it how you’d like.

It helps to constantly check your website on multiple browsers while developing…

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox to Internet explore
item.dc:creator: @Tea1 Tea_
item.description:
@Tea1 wrote:

Internet Explorer is becoming worse in trying to develop a website because it is becoming so basic (code wise, i believe) and they’re not excepting special things such as box-shadow properties and such. Also, for us to help you out, you will need to give us more information than:

[quote=“goldstylez, post:1, topic:548897”]I develop my website with firefox.
On school we only use Internet explore.
I found out the files didn’t work as it does on firefox.
So Internet explore does not read the same codes.

Any idea?

[/quote]

-Tea

Read full topic
